title: ClimMob 2.0 - tool to design and analyze citizen science trials (triadic ranking)
Submitted: Predictability of seasonal precipitation across major crop growing areas in Colombia
description: Predictability was limited towards eastern Colombia and during wet periods of the year in the Inter-Andean Valleys. Analyses use Canonical Correlation Analysis, with both observed SSTs and modeled (NCEPCFSv2) SSTs, as well as with CFSv2 predicted precipitation fields (through a Model-Output-Statistics analysis).

title: Ready-to-use analytical tools (R scripts, guidelines) developed that can be implemented
Support for the national and regional agroclimatic technical tables
CSA Compendium
description: This is the largest agricultural meta-analysis ever attempted. We review more than 70 practices and 40 outcome indicators.

title: Country Profiles
Developed robust gender-responsive framework for targeting and implementing CSAPs within CSVs for increased adoption
Automated agricultural climate forecasting interface for rice and maize production.
description: The automation of high-quality climate forecasting and the assessment thereof. Rigorous and replicable crop models to estimate yield under multiple forecast scenarios. Understanding of next user requirements, socialization of results and use thereof with stakeholders. Presentation of the generated information to stakeholders in usable and context appropriate format.

title: Data capture protocol for standardized climate, soil and management information at site-specific level
CSA Country Plans (5 Countries)
1.2 A generic protocol to calculate crop nutrient gaps for achieving balanced plant nutrition
description: A generic protocol to calculate minimum crop nutrient requirements (N, P, K) has been developed and applied to maize in nine countries in SSA. Results are publicly available on www.yieldgap.org; a report is available and a scientific publication is currently drafted (to be submitted to Global Food Security).

title: 1.3 Maps of nutrient gaps for different percentages of yield gap closure for project countries
description: These maps with minimum N input requirements and P and K uptake requirements have been completed in 2017, not only for the three project countries, but also for Burkina Faso, Ghana, Mali, Nigeria,  Uganda and Zambia. See www.yieldgap.org

title: Kenya County Climate Risk Profiles
description: CIAT has developed 31 county climate risk profiles to guide CSA investments and priorities for Kenyan counties. In each county, vulnerabilities, risks and coping options for two hazards are identified across four key value chains. The four value chains were identified for each country based on consultations with county stakeholders.

title: CSA Country Profiles for Africa -- 2017-2018
description: Developed by CIAT and CCAFS, in partnership with the World Bank, FAO, USAID, DFID and other partners, in 2017 and 2018 CSA Profiles will be completed for the following countries: Benin, Ethiopia, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Ivory Coast, Lesotho, Malawi, Mali, Mozambique, Niger, Togo, Tanzania, Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe.

title: Climate Wizard API and Integration WOCAT Climate Change Adaptation Module (Collaboration F2-CIAT)
description: The  ClimateWizard  REST  API is designed  to  query  climate  change  information  from  a  global  downscaled  Global  Climate  Model  (GCM)  database  hosted  at  CIAT. The  work  was  conducted  by  CIAT in   collaboration   with   WOCAT, and enables   the   querying   and   real-­time  access  to  climate  change  scenario  data.

title: Feasibility of using mobile phones and live operator calls to for monitoring
description: This data supports the research and manuscript where ICRAF with the London School of Tropical Hygiene and Medicine and World Food Program evaluated the use of computer assisted telephone interviews for monitoring and collecting data remotely. Conducting surveys in this way would allow collecting more data for less.

title: Strengths and limitations of computer assisted telephone interviews (CATI) for nutrition data collection in rural Kenya
description: This paper looked at the validity of using voice calls over mobile phones for collecting common nutrition indicators. This was a validation study of the method that is widely valuable across MRV and P4S is promoting as part of CSA-Plan.

title: CSA Compendium InfoNote
CSA Compendium Protocol Working Paper, CCAFS 138
Allometric framework for assessing the availability of residues from maize, rice, sorghum, millet and groundnut
description: Model based tools for fast appraisal of the productivity of residues at field level using non-destructive information about plant height and density.

title: Comprehensive assessment of mass balance and greenhouse gas emissions of gasifier cook stoves
description: Accurate information about savings in firewood consumption and offset in emissions is needed to prepare gasifier cook stove technologies for scaling, and gain access to climate finance markets.

title: Mapping of potential soil carbon sequestration rates through residues from field crops in smallholder farming systems
description: The amount of biochar that can be produced from residues of crops on farmer fields needs to be estimated in order to determine the viability of sequestering carbon through the scaling of biomass gasification technologies.

title: Concept note/proposal for country investment plan for LED interventions in rice production for Vietnam NDC
The feasibility of low emissions development interventions for the East African livestock sector: Lessons from Kenya and Ethiopia
description: Based upon geography, technical potential, the farmer interviews and discussions with national stakeholders, the three top recommended practices for reducing GHG emissions intensities are increasing the production of improved fodders in mixed systems and intensive dairy, the increased use of biodigestors in intensive dairy and managed grazing for pastoral systems.

title: Incorporating Gender into Low Emissions Development: a Case Study from Vietnam
description: Women are strongly involved in rice production, hence improving their access to AWD technology, participation in decisions about it, and capacity to use it influences AWD adoption and resulting emissions. Involving women in AWD and LED more broadly also can provide distributional and procedural justice gains for women.

title: Strategy for scaling (local) CSA Business cases in Haryana, Bihar, Punjab and Bangladesh
description: Considerable research has been conducted on farming practices and technologies to support the transition towards climate smart agriculture however not utilized at  their full potential impact for example due to low levels of adoption by smallholder farmers. Role of different SME to function as SP for uptake of CSA technologies

title: Atleast one peer reviewed publication on gender-responsive study to adaptation and scaling of CSAPs
description: Relative jointness of intra-household bargaining processes in low N use scenarios to assess the degree to which they impact upon N use is studied where gender-equitable strategies for achieving more balanced use of N to increase the likelihood of attaining macro-level reductions in GHG emissions to address food security.

title: Policy level engagement for investment on scaling CSAPs at aleast one sub-national level government
description: There has been growing concern for policy level initiatives& investment priorities for scaling CSAPs. Science based evidence generated through several consultations, communication materials created awareness among different stakeholders. These systematic efforts have led to policy level engagement process, partnerships and events for scaling by sub-national, national governments& other stakeholders.

title: Monitoring CSA implementation, performance and outcomes in the CCAFS Climate-Smart Villages: How to start?
description:
As part of the LP2. Participatory evaluation of CSA practices and portfolios a CSV monitoring Plan was designed to annually collect through standard indicators, evidence on:
 CSA practices’ effectiveness at plot level
 CSA related outcomes at farm and household level and
 Adoption trends and drivers

title: Improved weather indices for key crops disaggregated by region
In-season crop yield forecast
description: CRAFT is tested and evaluated for crop yield forecasting in Nepal at national and sub-national level. This tool is providing crop yield forecast (rice and wheat) with minimum error (less than 10%).

title: NADiRA (Nurturing Africa’s Digital Revolution for Agriculture) concept note submitted to H2020 SPACE2017 call
description: The above mentioned concept note was developed into a full proposal and accepted for funding by the European Commission for a total budget of EUR 1,950,000. The NADiRA project was subsequently started in 2017, and joint activities leveraging CCAFS/CASCAID already implemented.

title: Hydro-meteorological data measured at project sites
description: IWMI is gathering hydrological and meteorological data at Banlek and Shikharpur using four automatic measurement stations and manual data collection at various sites. Quality checked version of all collected data will be submitted at the end of the project.

title: Watershed management practices under changing landuse practices in the semi-arid region of Mali
description: Watershed management practices like that of contour bunding, drip irrigation and shallow wells have been implemented by farmers over time in southern Mali. Farmers use these practices to improve yield performance and increase the household income to improve cotton yield and reduce erosion rate by 40% at farmers’ field level.

The Integrated assessment tool is used for evaluating different SLM and sustainable intensification strategies under dry-land farming systems in SAT regions.

title: Farmers' demand for climate services
description: Info Note building on Trinh's PhD thesis, we go deeper into categories of farmers who see the need for and are willing to pay for climate services, specifically discussing gender and economic flexibility

title: Monitoring CSA performance and outcomes in the Climate-Smart Villages: Ready… set, go!
description: This blog post describes the implementation in Lawra-Jirapa (Ghana) of the first comprehensive trial of the freshly developed multi-scale CSV Monitoring Plan, which build on the use of two data collection instruments :  the“CSA Farm Calculator Tool” and The Smart Monitoring App.

title: Farming and the geography of nutrient production for human use: a transdisciplinary analysis
description: Here we provide a plausible breakdown of global agricultural and nutrient production by farm size, and also study the associations between farm size, agricultural diversity, and nutrient production.

title: Perception of Climate Change and Impact on Land Allocation and Income: Evidence from Vietnam?s Delta Region
description: The paper examines factors affecting smallholder households? perceptions of climate change, and the impact on income and land allocation. The paper finds that perception of climate change has significant negative impacts on households income. Smallholders with perceived climate changes reduce land allocated to paddy and increase rented land.
